description: What constitutes an effective community serving program? What works? What doesn't work? Is it possible to answer the effectiveness question? Calling attention to a problem whether it's improving the life prospects of a low income child in a developing country from disease, is the first and easiest step in solving the problem. This course will examine the effectiveness question primariliy through case studies of four different types of community serving programs--alternative teacher certification programs (e.g. Teach for America, NYC Teaching Fellows, ACE), structured mentoring programs, pregnancy prevention programs for students in public schools, and malaria prevention treatement in Africa.
name: Developing Effective Community Serving Programs
